item.description:
The City of Lowell celebrates its 8th annual Winterfest. Activities include the National Human Dog Sled Competition and much more. The events are capped off on Saturday night by a 7 pm fireworks display at City Hall on J.F.K. Plaza and a free public skate at the Tsongas Arena.

Let's plan to meet at 5:30, location TBD and take in the sites, find a quiet place to eat and chat, watch the fireworks and then head to the "Nordic Nightclub- Club Celsius" for the evening festivities listed below. Club Celsius is a heated tent on Arcand Drive with live music throughout Winterfest. Food and beverages available for charge. You must be 21 + to enter, except Saturday afternoon when all ages are invited.

5 - 7 pm - Lisa Love Experience, classic rock cover band

7:30 - 8:30 pm - Sully's Elvis Review - Sully's Review is backed by the band No Exit. No Exit plays hits from the 70s thru today before Sully joins them on stage for a review of Elvis' greatest hits. Sully is a local legend and a Winterfest tradition.

9 - 11:30 pm - Jim Plunkett sings and plays the great songs from the 60's, 70's and
80's to keep you dancing, singing and having a great time.

A complete schedule for Friday and Saturday can be
viewed at www.lowellwinterfest.org. All above activities are free!
item.how_to_find_us: email me before 5:30 for cell number. some of us will be at JFK Plaza for the fireworks at 7 and will then head to the tent on Arcand Drive for the music. I have an aqua color snow jacket. :-)

group.name: Fun in So. NH and Merrimack Valley

item.name: Lowell Winterfest 2008
